intro: Wahlenbergia bowkerae, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowers are tubular and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
